conversation.message: School_B is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I strongly want to join your community and would commit to enrolling if accepted. I’m especially interested in your academic environment and would be excited to contribute actively to classes and school activities. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. However, School_B’s priority list ranks me 4th (behind Student_E, Student_B, Student_C), and several of those students also rank School_B highly, so acceptance is uncertain. Still, applying now is optimal because it’s my first choice and there is no cost to trying in this round; if rejected, I can move to School_C next round where I am ranked 3rd and may have a better chance. My message should clearly express strong fit and commitment to improve acceptance chances.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and for sharing your strong interest in School_B. After reviewing applications we received this round, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time.

We appreciate your interest in our community and wish you the very best in the rest of the process.
conversation.thought: As School_B with quota 1, my true priority is E > B > C > D > A. In this round I received APPLY from D, C, and A. Among these, C is ranked higher than D and A. Since accepting D now would finalize a match and prevent me from matching with a higher-priority applicant (C) who is already applying, I should reject D to preserve the seat for a better-ranked candidate. E and B are above C, but neither contacted me this round; still, C is currently available and preferable to D. Therefore reject D.

conversation.message: Hello School_B Admissions Committee—I'm Student_C. School_B is my first choice, and I’m applying because I strongly want to join your community. I’m ready to commit if accepted and would be grateful for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B. Although I am not the highest priority there (Student_E and Student_B are ahead of me), applying immediately gives me the only chance to secure it if higher-priority students go elsewhere or do not apply. Waiting risks losing School_B to others, so I will apply now with a clear, committed message.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your application and for naming School_B as your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you admission to School_B. If you are ready to commit to enrolling, we look forward to welcoming you to our community.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions Committee
conversation.thought: As School_B, my true priority is E > B > C > D > A. In this round I received APPLY messages from D, C, and A. Among these, Student_C is the highest on my list, and I have quota 1. While Student_E (my top choice) did not contact me this round and could apply later, rejecting C now risks ending up with a lower-priority match (or none) if E never applies or matches elsewhere. Accepting C secures my best available option from the current inbox and is consistent with maximizing my outcome within quota.

conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions Committee, I’m Student_A and I’m formally applying to School_B as my first choice. I’m very motivated to join your community and would enthusiastically accept an offer if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. However, School_B’s priority list ranks me last, while higher-priority students (Student_E, Student_B, Student_C, Student_D) are likely to apply there as well since it is a top choice for several of them. Even so, applying now is still optimal because (1) there is no cost to being rejected in this process, (2) an early application is my only chance if others pursue different options, and (3) School_B is my highest-ranked school, so I should not delay. I will send a concise but strong application highlighting fit and commitment.

conversation.message:

We appreciate your interest in our community and wish you the very best in the rest of the process.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions Committee
conversation.thought: Our quota is already filled (matched with Student_C) and remaining quota is 0. Under the rules, we must reject any new [APPLY] messages. Even though Student_A is on our priority list, we cannot accept without capacity, and Student_C is ranked above Student_A on School_B's true priority list anyway.

conversation.message: Hello School_A Admissions, I’m Student_E. School_A is one of my top choices, and I’m very excited about the possibility of joining your community. I value a strong academic environment and would be eager to contribute positively to campus life. I would like to formally apply—thank you for your consideration.

I have the #1 priority at School_A (and also School_B), and School_A is my 3rd choice—still very good. To maximize the chance of securing a high-ranked match quickly, I will apply to School_A now, where acceptance is highly likely regardless of competition.

Therefore, I should accept Student_E now.
